//: A rural holdout survivor trying to stay safe

dynamic_line.no: Ayuh, I was thinkin' it's just another monstah skulkin' about.  Who are you?

responses.text: Just a survivor, looking around.  What are you doing here?
What did you before all this?
Is there something I can do for you?

dynamic_line: I worked on a ranch not too fah from here 'fore it all went down.  I'd love ta get back ta what I did - taking care of horses, cows, all sorts of animals, makin' sure the fields stay safe an' all that.  But now?  I dunno, man.  Just tryin' ta survive, I suppose.  Hopefully, tha world will get back togetha' one day and I can put mah skills ta use doin' what I like.
I was just sort of wanderin' around, hoping ta maybe find some bettah gear.  Decided ta rest up, 'eard someone walkin', and, well, here we are.
Can't say I can think of summin' specific right now.  Gotta say though, maybe it oughta be a good idea for us ta travel togetha' - safety in numbers an' all that.

responses.text: Is it a good idea to trust a stranger like me this easily?
Sounds like a good idea - want to join me, then?

dynamic_line: Wicked.  Been around the old road long enough ta know how ta handle myself in a pinch.  Knew my way around a gun ever since my da taught me when I was a kid, so ya don't have ta worry about me doing my part.

responses.text: On a second thought, let me think about it a bit more

dynamic_line: Don't have much of a choice, do I?  On my own, a monstah will get lucky sooner or later, and even if I kill it, bleedin' out in some alley is not summin' I fancy.  Plus, we just had a nice, civil chat where no one tried ta kill the otha', so I reckon we're off to ah' good start, all things considered.

responses.text: Fair enough.  Want to travel with me, then?
Can't say I really agree.  I'll be going now.

dynamic_line: Wha', nevah been ta Boston 'ave ya?  Hope you're not 'avin a hahd time keepin' up with me, but if ya get used ta it, wicked good fun, let me tell ya.
